item.title: thousands of afghans rally in kabul to reject any peace with taliban
item.description: the gathering, which drew 10,000 people, was a frontal attack on the current government's policies, and speakers denounced both al qaeda and the taliban.

item.title: senate panel slams goldman in scathing crisis report
item.description: in the most damning official u.s. report yet produced on wall street's role in the financial crisis, a senate panel accused powerhouse goldman sachs of misleading clients and manipulating markets, while also condemning greed, weak regulation and conflicts of interest throughout the financial system.

item.title: usain bolt can still get faster, says michael johnson
item.description: usain bolt has the potential to astound the world again after rewriting the men's 100 and 200 meters records over two epic seasons, four-times olympic sprint champion michael johnson said monday.

item.title: burglar feels the heat dangling over hot oil vat
item.description: police answering cries for help on friday found a screaming burglar dangling from a ceiling air vent over a hot fat fryer at an upstate new york restaurant.

item.title: u.s. says medicare to exhaust funds sooner
item.description: two of the government's most popular programs for the elderly, medicare and social security, will run out of money sooner than thought earlier as a slow-growing economy saps revenues, a report on friday said.

item.title: mendenhall causes stir with bin laden tweets
item.description: rashard mendenhall has created a stir with comments made on his official twitter page regarding osama bin laden's death.

item.title: thieves vandalize dozens of patrol cars outside atlanta
item.description: a suburban atlanta police department was itself a crime victim after thieves broke into 43 patrol cars, causing $10,000 in damage.

item.description: carbon dating shows that neanderthals didn't last as long as thought, throwing into doubt the idea that they may have interbred with early humans.

item.title: federer stops djokovic to reach paris final
item.description: roger federer ended novak djokovic's 41-match winning streak with a 7-6 6-3 3-6 7-6 victory on friday to set up a french open final meeting with old rival rafa nadal. serbian second seed djokovic went off the rails as the third-seeded federer raised his game to new heights to reach his fifth final at roland garros, and his first grand-slam final since last year's australian open.

item.description: if a bill approved by florida's house of representatives becomes law, it will establish the deepest and most far-reaching cuts in unemployment benefits in the nation.

item.description: lucas glover won his first title since the 2009 u.s. open by beating his former college team mate jonathan byrd on the first hole of a sudden-death playoff at the quail hollow championship on sunday.
